revision.text: {{talk header}} {{WPBS|1= {{WPCanada|class=c |military=y |importance=low}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=c|B1=y|B2=N|B3=Y|B4=Y|B5=Y}} {{WPMILHIST|class=c|B1=y|B2=N|B3=Y|B4=Y|B5=Y|Maritime=yes|British=yes|Canadian=yes}} }} ==News article== HMCS Corner Brook approaches aircraft carrier undetected http://www.forces.gc.ca/site/community/mapleleaf/article_e.asp?id=3627 ==Crew list== No one found it a little bit odd that the entire crew of an active-duty warship is listed by rank, full name and position on an open-source website? [[OPSEC]] anyone? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/84.202.223.202|84.202.223.202]] ([[User talk:84.202.223.202|talk]]) 15:28, 22 May 2009 (UTC) The Canadian Forces has already seen fit to make that information public, in the 'Sub Departments' pages of the submarine's webpages at http://www.navy.forces.gc.ca/cornerbrook/3/3-s_eng.asp?category=67&title=773 . Assuming that the information there is true, if they want to make the information public /there/, I see no reason for us to conceal it /here/. [[User:Datapacrat|DataPacRat]] ([[User talk:Datapacrat|talk]]) 22:17, 28 July 2009 (UTC) :There is concern that lists of commanding officers for warships/submarines do not belong, as the information adds very little to the understanding of the subject at hand (in this case, HMCS ''Corner Brook''). If lists of COs are 'maybe', I think that lists of the entire boat's company would be a solid 'no' under [[WP:What Wikipedia is not]], particularly "Not an indiscriminate collection of information", point 5, and "Not a directory", point 7. -- [[User:Saberwyn|saberwyn]] 04:57, 14 May 2010 (UTC) == Location == [[User:Indefatigable]] has stated in his /her edit summary: "St John's is not on the Labrador coast." I put that bit in , wrongly it would seem, to try and help the reader know where St Johns is. If it is wrong, Indefatigable, how about correcting it? [[User:RASAM|RASAM]] ([[User talk:RASAM|talk]]) 21:47, 16 March 2012 (UTC) : With St John's being the capital of the province, I did not think its location needed elaboration, especially since it is hyperlinked and in a photo caption, which should be kept brief. But if we do decide to elaborate, what should we put? [[Avalon Peninsula]] would not work -- if you know where that is, you probably already know where St John's is. "Eastern Newfoundland" is probably the best we can do. [[User:Indefatigable|Indefatigable]] ([[User talk:Indefatigable|talk]]) 22:17, 18 March 2012 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[HMCS Corner Brook (SSK 878)]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=699566509 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20100321164415/http://www.aviationweek.com/aw/blogs/defense/index.jsp?plckController=Blog to http://www.aviationweek.com/aw/blogs/defense/index.jsp?plckController=Blog&plckScript=blogScript&plckElementId=blogDest&plckBlogPage=BlogViewPost&plckPostId=Blog%3a27ec4a53-dcc8-42d0-bd3a-01329aef79a7Post%3a95467618-62e2-4147-a111-a1821f9d15f6 When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 02:49, 13 January 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:4|one external link|4 external links}} on [[HMCS Corner Brook (SSK 878)]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=704901574 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20100628112013/http://www.navy.forces.gc.ca:80/cms/3/3-a_eng.asp?category=7 to http://www.navy.forces.gc.ca/cms/3/3-a_eng.asp?category=7&id=626 *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20110613033324/http://www.navy.forces.gc.ca/cms_gallery/acrobat_e.asp?pdf=/cms_images/news/story_images/crowsnest_v2-i2.pdf to http://www.navy.forces.gc.ca/cms_gallery/acrobat_e.asp?pdf=/cms_images/news/story_images/crowsnest_v2-i2.pdf *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20110609135318/http://www.forces.gc.ca/site/Commun/ml-fe/article-eng.asp?id=4110 to http://www.forces.gc.ca/site/Commun/ml-fe/article-eng.asp?id=4110 *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20090331220322/http://www.cbc.ca:80/canada/nova-scotia/story/2009/02/17/ns-warships-exercise.html to http://www.cbc.ca/canada/nova-scotia/story/2009/02/17/ns-warships-exercise.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 08:39, 14 February 2016 (UTC)
